title: Toloache's Dulce de Leche Sufganiyot
directions: Make the Dulce de Leche Filling: Halfway fill a large pot with water, bring to a hard boil.
Place the three unopened cans of evaporated milk in the boiling water; allow water to continue on a hard boil for 3 hours.
After the three hours, remove cans from the water. Open the cans and pour the dulce de leche into a pastry bag with a small tip. Keep dulce de leche at room temperature until ready to use.
Make the Donuts: Combine the flour, dry milk, salt, shortening, eggs and sugar in a large bowl. Mix well. Then add the water, stirring until the mixture thickens to form the dough.
Take the dough by hand to shape it into 1-inch balls.

Pour the vegetable oil in a large pot and bring to a boil. Drop the balls of dough into the vegetable oil and allow to cook for about 5 minutes, or until golden brown. When the donuts are ready, take them out of the oil and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil.
Assemble and Serve: With a pairing knife, make an incision into the center of each donut. Fill each donut with the Dulce de Leche using the pastry bag.
Place 2 donuts per plate and sprinkle with Confectioners' Sugar.
